newsitem.title: CANADA: Bombardier rises on regional jet order.
newsitem.headline: Bombardier rises on regional jet order.

text.p: Shares of Bombardier Inc rose 0.40 on the Toronto Stock Exchange Tuesday to 25.80 after Atlantic Southeast Airlines (ASA) said it intended to order 30 of its Regional Jet aircraft.
The US$600 million order is the single largest transaction for the 50-seat jet, Bombardier said. ASA also said it agreed to options to purchase an additional 60 Regional Jet planes.

The order is a significant boost for Bombardier's Regional Jet program. Before the ASA order, there were 176 Regional Jets on order, of which 142 were in service with 14 operators in eight countries, Bombardier said.
ASA is the fourth regional carrier in the United States to choose the Regional Jet, Bombardier said. Other commercial airline customers include Lufthansa's CityLine unit.
An analyst who declined to be identified said the huge order places Bombardier at the forefront of developing markets for its 50-seat and planned 70-seat Regional Jet.
"It's a huge step forward in terms of what regional airlines have decided they will be flying into the next century," the analyst said.
"I think that with this order Bombardier is sort of untouchable," he said.
